card_title: A moderate number of information blocks
how: This incentive is designed to help readers easily distinguish one piece of information from another, facilitate the absorption of new information, and decrease people's perception of complexity.
effective_1: I am interested in this particular graphic because it is very concise and straightforward
effective_2: There are a lot of numbers. The infographic looks complicated, and I don't want to look at it

how: This incentive means a well-organized layout can reduce cognitive load and is better understood.
effective_1: This infographic looks very cluttered and cramped, with too little white space and too much information packed in
effective_2: I quite like it at first glance, anyway. I'm really into this kind of block-by-block layout, which gives a very organized feeling.

how: This incentive allows for a balanced and visually appealing design to avoid being overwhelming and confusing to the viewer
effective_1: it reminds me of advice from stylists, "do not wear more than three colors in an outfit otherwise you'll look like a clown or a parrot'. The color scheme in the infographic looks messy and I don't feel like reading more about it
effective_2: This is quite eye-catching. The color scheme looks different

how: This incentive unifies different parts into a whole to cause a visual echo.
effective_1: Each heatmap resembles a dancing musical note. It is intriguing
effective_2: These are maps of the western United States, and the variation in color on them makes them appear quite distinct and legible.

how: This incentive help create a gradual transition between different hues, shades, and tints, which can add depth, texture, and vibrancy to infographics.
effective_1: the different shades of pink to create a sense of extension, which looks quite comfortable
effective_2: I really like this image because it's very simple and artistic with just one color variation. It gives me a sense of minimalism and elegance

how: This incentive attracts participants' attention and triggered their curiosity toward the infographic.
effective_1: These three wolves are quite intriguing, especially the one in the middle with reduced opacity. I'm curious about what's going on with that

how: This incentive use decorative visual elements to benefit the reception of visualization.
effective_1: When looking at the illustration, I assumed that the infographic is about saving wildlife, specifically for birds, and I started getting interested in it
effective_2: I might be more interested in this one because it includes a photo. I would be curious to know if the photo is related to the message they are trying to convey

how: This incentive can result in a sense of overwhelming to catch readers' attention and shocks them
effective_1: The large expanse of red immediately catches my attention and shocks me
effective_2: At first glance, it's actually quite eye-catching to me, with the black background and the two big red and blue circles.

how: This incentive makes an infographic arousing and exciting.
effective_1: I was first drawn to the vibrant red color of it, which caught my attention. It looks really appealing, almost like a fruit
effective_2: I can feel the tension, as yellow is often associated with caution

how: This incentive refers to combining pairs of "opposite" colors on the color wheel to create a sense of harmoniousness.
effective_1: I'm particularly interested in this chart because the color contrast seems to be quite significant, which makes it look very striking
effective_2: This infographic uses the combination of red and blue to produce a perfect match and encourages comparing the difference between the two colored components

how: This incentive refers to explained terminologies and abbreviations to help readers understand and interpret.
effective_1: This infographic uses full names in its data source and legend to present information as clearly as possible and convey a respect for readers

how: This incentive can provide readers with a framework for accurately interpreting the data.
effective_1: It displays the hottest and coldest temperatures in both Fahrenheit and Celsius degrees, making it easy to comprehend at a glance

how: This incentive explains key information or counterintuitive facts to answer questions and achieve a sense of enlightenment.
effective_1: This infographic caught my attention because it provides annotations at the turning points of the trendline in the bar chart. It helps answer the readers' question about why Africa's elephant population is declining, which is also mentioned in the title

how: This incentive uses bright colors, big sizes, or conspicuous positions to direct readers' attention to a focal point.
effective_1: its title is very clear with large font and a colored background
effective_2: I immediately noticed the red headline

how: This incentive use identical colors to associate textual and visual information.
effective_1: I read from the title to the visualization, and then to the annotation
effective_2: I understand now that red indicates an improvement in air quality and yellow indicates a decline in air quality, so these three small bar charts can be looked at together

how: This incentive can emphasize the relationship between the two elements and guide readers' eyes along that path.
effective_1: I think this infographic is really effective because it uses a black arrow and contour line to clearly highlight the location of the Amazon basin in Brazil. It's really easy to follow and reader-friendly

how: This incentive places related elements such as chart and legend, axis and unit, close to each other to form a group, enabling readers to quickly identify the required information.
effective_1: Although this chart shows multiple data dimensions, it's clear and easy to understand
effective_2: So this legend corresponds to the bar chart above? It's placed too far away, I didn't realize there was a legend here until after I finished looking at the chart

how: This incentive refers to color choices that are evocative of a given concept to help readers quickly get the idea
effective_1: I can quickly get the idea as the treemap uses green to show the used forest and brown to show the used cropland

how: This incentive allows readers to feel closer to the story and relate to it more easily
effective_1: the annotation "we are here" immediately caught my attention and evoked empathy for the situation: this summer has been unusually hot, it hasn't rained for a long time

how: This incentive can be effective to involve readers in the story to make them feel more engaged and connected
effective_1: I feel engaged and connected as it feels as if I'm part of the story
effective_2: I find this infographic interesting because it uses "you" and makes me feel like it's speaking directly to me.

how: This incentive links the headline of an infographic to its visually prominent features, creating the effect of bringing data-driven storytelling full circle.
effective_1: As I see it, this infographic really drives home the main point of the title, which is that Britain has made the biggest strides in reducing carbon emissions among all wealthy countries. The declining trendline that represents Britain in the line chart, along with the color choice and bold font of the annotation, all work together to reinforce this message.
effective_2: It holds things together and presents the conclusion very clear

how: This incentive provides solutions to the discussed issues to make the infographic more practical.
effective_1: Having one less child can reduce a significant amount of CO2 emissions. It seems that as a DINK (Double Income No Kids), I'm doing the Earth a favor

how: This incentive provides a glimpse of future data trends to help readers make informed decisions.
effective_1: I'll give it a heart, as it visualizes both the present and the future, I can learn more from it
effective_2: Wait, are you saying that our carbon emissions will be this high if we don't take any action? This graph makes it crystal clear, and I can't help but think that the government should be doing more to protect the environment.
